Do you wish you could maintain clean floors without exerting yourself? We've compiled a list of the top robot vacuums we've tested to help you choose the ideal model for your home's cleaning needs, and they're more powerful and inexpensive than ever.


The development of vacuum cleaners has progressed significantly. You won't have to be humiliated by lugging around a bulky, wheeled container the size of a Galapagos tortoise and a plastic hose attached to it anymore. You can avoid getting up from the sofa altogether. Without lifting a finger, you can get rid of dust, pet hair, and other household trash with a robot vacuum.


Robot vacuum cleaners, as opposed to canister or stick types, are self-sufficient and (typically) intelligent. Our proven vacuums include lasers, motherboards, sensors, and even Wi-Fi so they can move around your home without human intervention. You won't have to deal with them too much until one of a few specific situations arises.


Locate the dock where the robot can get to it, and it will come back before it runs out of energy and charges itself. If this happens, it will rest until it is recharged, at which point it will return to the fray and pick up where it left off, busting dust as it goes. Most cleaning bots also have schedules where you can tell them to get up and go to work while you're out of the house. Until the vacuum empties, you may put off having to deal with anyone physically. And some models even have self-emptying trash cans!


Which robot vacuum is best for you, with all its many options? To help you choose, we've compiled a list of the top models we've reviewed. Find out what we think are the best robot vacuums and what other considerations you should make before purchasing.


1. iRobot Roomba j7+

SPECIFICATIONS

Cleaning Performance: 91.81

Pet Hair Score: 82.5

Bin Size: up to 60 days

Size: 13.3 x 3.4 inches

Weight: 7.5 pounds

Smart Home Compatibility: Alexa &''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''' Google Assistant

PROS

+ Superb ability to sidestep problems

+Benefits from data-cleaning-based learning

+The limitation of access is simple to establish.

+Modified Clean Base now blends in better.


CONS

-Powerful, crystal-clear low-end.

-Carpet's just so-so in picking up pet hair.


The latest Roomba from iRobot, the j7+, is a cut above the rest thanks to its ability to navigate around furniture and other obstacles. Thanks to this, it can avoid obstacles like wires and socks that it may otherwise run into. The ability of the robot to avoid pet feces is the key benefit of this function. iRobot is so sure that the Roomba j7+ is smart that they are replacing any j7+ that can't detect and avoid solid pet waste under the Pet Owner Official Promise (P.O.O.P.). This robot vacuum is one of the smartest we've seen since it always improves with each use. As a result, it was named the best robot vacuum of 2022 by Tom's Guide.


The cleaning base included with the j7+ is excellent. The detritus it can keep is 60 days, more compact, and aesthetically pleasing compared to other bases. Scores of 98.33 and 94.6% for collecting cereal and kitty litter indicate that this robot vacuum does a good job with these major material types. Even though we've seen higher marks for pet hair, an 82.5 percent accuracy rate is rather good. If your pet has a history of accidents and you'd like to limit the damage to your home, this is a worthwhile purchase.

2. Shark IQ Robot

SPECIFICATIONS

Dimensions 12.9 by 12.6 by 3.5 inches

Battery Life (Tested) 97 minutes

Mop/Vacuum Hybrid No


PROS

+It maps your house for scheduling, area cleaning, and virtual no-go zones

+it has a bagless self-emptying base and a self-cleaning brush roll.

+Compatible with the Google Assistant and Amazon Alexa

+Includes a solid strip of demarcation

+ never froze during a test.


CONS

-Battery life evaluations

-It can be obnoxious.


While the goal of employing a robot vacuum is to reduce the amount of time spent cleaning, most of them need to be emptied and cleaned often. The Shark I.Q. Robot Self-Empty XL R101AE ($599) is a low-maintenance choice that cleans swiftly and effectively, gets stuck seldom, and has a huge dustbin in its docking station that only has to be emptied once a month. You may use your phone or voice to command the robot, and you can program it to clean at specific times.


Unlike the iRobot Roomba i3+, which retails for a comparable amount, this vacuum creates a map of your home as it cleans, allowing you to direct it to specific areas and set up virtual no-go zones. The self-cleaning brush roll and sufficient suction force make it an attractive choice for pet owners. For these reasons, we have chosen to award the R101AE with our Editor's Choice.

3. Roborock S6 MaxV

SPECIFICATIONS

Runtime: 200 minutes

Size: 12 oz / 0.36 liter

Self-emptying: No

Wi-Fi control: Yes


PROS


+efficient and quick cleaning

+a user-friendly mobile app


CONS


-Remember that you have some cleaning up to do first.

-Not the cheapest option

-Do not have stair climbing ability (yet)


When it comes to runtime, the Roborock S6 MaxV shines. Roborock claims that in its weakest mode, it can clean continuously for up to three hours. We found that using the 'balanced mode,' in the middle of the performance spectrum, resulted in a 20% drop in battery life after 30 minutes of cleaning a 20 square meter (215 square foot) space.


The Roborock S6 MaxV can quickly map a room thanks to its two cameras and Lidar. It will also take a picture of any obstructions, such as abandoned shoes or furniture, and label them on the map so you can see them in the app. The software uses AI-based processing to detect the obstruction and generally succeeds.


We were delighted with how well it picked up dust on carpets and hard floors and found that it sucked up dust just as well as the leading brands. It's one of the largest robot vacuums we've tried, taking up a lot of room and having trouble getting in between chair legs because of its dual functionality (mopping and vacuuming). Despite its massive size, it operates with relatively little noise.

4. Yeedi Vac 2 Pro

SPECIFICATIONS

Runtime: Up to 220 mins.

Diameter:13.77 inches

Height:3.03 inches

Battery Capacity： 5200 mAh

PROS

+ Low profile structure fits under low clearance furniture

+One of the least expensive with obstacle avoidance &'''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''' vibrating pad (under three inches)

+Effective mopping performance with oscillating pad

+ High-end cleaning performance due to its high airflow

+ Decent at deep cleaning carpet

CONS

-It has poor hair tangle resistance

-a tendency to stop on filthy pads

-and it can only store one map level.


Yeedi's most recent product, the Vac 2 Pro, features two significant upgrades: front laser sensors enabling obstacle avoidance as well as a vibrating mopping component that the company refers to as an "oscillating mopping system." One further improvement was made to the obstacle avoidance systems using the front laser sensors, which improved the vehicle's ability to avoid collisions with obstacles. Aside from these two improvements, the Vac 2 Pro is comparable to the Vac Station but has (slightly) less airflow than the latter.


Customers will be able to choose between two models: one that simply includes the robot, and another that also includes the auto-empty base station. The Yeedi app works with the Vac 2 Pro, which comes with several amazing features that will be listed below. When compared to the other robot vacuums that I've examined, connecting the app or robot takes a somewhat different approach. In order to complete their purchase, customers will need to scan a QR code that is located here next to the trash can. As this robot can communicate with Vac Statio base station, it is an additional choice that may be taken into consideration.

5. Roborock S7

SPECIFICATIONS

Cleaning performance: 93

Pet hair score: 85.8bin

Size: 470 ml

Smart home compatibility: alexa, google assistant

Size: 13.9 x 13.8 x 3.8 inches

Weight: 10.4 pounds


PROS

+Automatic mop rising

+Accurate carpet sensing +Quick mapping


CONS


-There are hitches while dividing areas in the app.

-The lint from the mop might become caught in the rug's fibers.


We have examined several hybrid robot vacuum/robot mop models, and up to the Roborock S7, they have all performed adequately but not exceptional at either duty. For the first time, we feel comfortable leaving the S7 to vacuum and mop without human intervention. The S7 has the intelligence to detect when it's on a rug, and it will raise the mopping pad accordingly.


The S7 had a decent performance as a vacuum cleaner; however, it wasn't the greatest at picking up pet hair. However, it was quick and thorough, with an average score of 93. It's at its best on hard surfaces, but it still does a respectable job (an average of above 90) on the carpet. Additionally, it contains convenient features, including floor plans for several stories, restricted areas, and a timetable. The Roborock S7 is a good option if you want a robot vacuum that can also wash the floor.


Do Robot Vacuums Work?


Robot vacuums cost more than regular vacuums (though not always). These versions cost $200 to $1,000. Even low-end, that's a big investment. Consider the value.


Unless you love it, vacuuming is boring. Depending on the size of your home, a robot vacuum can save you minutes to hours each week. That alone makes some individuals want one.


Robot vacuums are equally strong and effective as ordinary vacuums. These robots combine rotating brush rolls and side brushes to clean like uprights. They're little and won't take up much room. They can fit under most sofas and tables, so no furniture rearrangement is needed.


Wi-Fi robot vacuums are now cheaper. Connectivity's benefits Smartphones can operate and program smart robot vacuums. Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant can control many.


Connected bots create cleaning statistics and maps. Many build customized floor designs, allowing for focused room cleanings and avoiding the need for "virtual barriers."


Some of the most modern robot vacuums, like the iRobot Roomba j7+, have cameras and A.I. to avoid shoes, toys, and pet waste. Premium versions may operate as roaming home security cameras, allowing you to see live footage from anywhere.


Robot Vacuum Cleaning


Not cleaning your robot vacuum is one of 9 common vacuuming blunders.

We forget that robot vacuums need maintenance because they clean. Unless you have a self-emptying model, you'll need to empty the bins after every run. Cut any hairs trapped in the spinning brush and clean the filters. Eufy, iLife, Neato, and Roborock provide cleaning tools. Your handbook will tell you when and where to change the filters.


Robot vacuum performance will suffer if you don't empty the bin or check for tangled hairs. A full bin will drag any trash rather than pick it up.


App-connected robot vacuums may provide maintenance tips and cleaning reminders. Some include alternative schedules, so you don't need a diary!


Noteworthy Features


● Premium models have self-emptying. The robot vacuum will self-empty when its dustbin is full. This is stored at the dock until the larger bin is filled. Self-emptying versions help allergy sufferers by releasing dust less often.


● Most robot vacuums can link to your smartphone over Wi-Fi, but lower-end versions don't. Depending on the model, you can control and monitor your robot vacuum from your phone.


● Some hybrid vacuums can also mop. The Roborock S7 is an exception to this rule.


● Some robot vacuums map your environment using sensors to recall barriers like staircases. If the robot vacuum has Wi-Fi access, it may display a map on your phone and plot the optimum cleaning path.


● With mapping technology, you can designate no-go zones around your pet's food dishes or an expensive rug.


● Similar to no-go zones, some allow you to clean a specific room.


● Mapping can cover multiple floors, essential if you live on multiple levels.


● Scheduling is a popular robot vacuum function. You may plan daily, weekly, or away-from-home cleanings by linking to your smartphone.


● Some entry-level robot vacuums include a remote instead of Wi-Fi. You can manage it hands-free with fewer settings.


● A base-equipped model may self-charge between runs. If the model you're considering must be manually plugged in, you may return to a half-finished project.


● Minimum 400ml, unless self-emptying. Self-emptying variants have vacuum bags in the charging base, whereas robot dustbins are bagless. Our guide compares bagged and bagless vacuums.
